steps.text: Alright, so today we're diving into something really important. How do you actually protect your restaurant's revenue when it comes to delivery?
We're going to break down exactly how delivery works, where the money leaks out, and honestly? How to fix it. Let's get into it.
So here's the thing. Restaurants make money three ways, right? Dine-in, takeout, and delivery.
Dine-in? You see the customer, you control everything. Takeout? They walk in, grab their food, and leave. Pretty straightforward.
But delivery... that's where it gets interesting. Your food goes to a complete stranger. And once it leaves your kitchen? You basically lose visibility into everything that happens next.
Let me paint the picture here. The restaurant makes the food. That's your job, you're good at it.
But then the platform takes over. DoorDash, Uber Eats, Grubhub. They own the customer relationship. They handle the payment. They do the delivery.
And here's the kicker. When something goes wrong? The customer complains to the platform, not to you. You have zero direct recourse. None.
Okay, this one's kind of scary. Picture this. Inside the store, everything looks great. Busy kitchen, staff working hard, orders coming in.
But on the app? Your store shows as unavailable. Completely invisible to customers. They can't even see you exist.
That's revenue that never even gets a chance to happen. And the worst part? Nobody inside the restaurant even knows.
